intro: Rhynchostigma racemosum, commonly known as the clustered bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with a hairy texture. Rhynchostigma racemosum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
